ngiemboon: Á gʉa na pʉ̀a Amoŋ, mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɛté ngie:
en: About the Ammonites,   this is what the Lord says:

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie:
en: Therefore look, the days are coming    —

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Eshÿemboŋ,
en: Wail, Heshbon,   for Ai is devastated;

ngiemboon: Gù tÿǒsoŋo Lamba, á gù múɔngùɔ gẅie ɔ̀ kɔ̌ɔn ńtʉʉ pɔ́ twó.
en: Why do you boast about your valleys,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, e Ssé gie e piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Look, I am about to bring terror on you    —

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ayɛ̌ fʉ̀ʼ ge gÿo tɔ́g,
en: But after that, I will restore the fortunes   of the Ammonites.  # 49:6 Jr 48:47; 49:39

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa na pʉ̀a Éndɔ̀m, mbà nò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gɔ̌ɔn ńtí wɔ́b, á yɔɔn:
en: About Edom,   this is what the Lord of Armies says:

ngiemboon: Pi sele nnɛ́ ńkÿo, á gẅí pʉ̀a Ndendaŋ,
en: Run! Turn back! Lie low,

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ gie pakáb mentɔ̌ɔn tÿǒ ge gÿo tóo nkáʼ pi,
en: If grape harvesters came to you,

ngiemboon: Á nue mèŋ zɔ ge gÿo túʼu gẅí,
en: But I will strip Esau bare;

ngiemboon: “Afʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ te gíŋ ńgwɔ́ wó wɔ́,
en: Abandon your fatherless; I will preserve them;

ngiemboon: Ánò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn, á yɔɔn:
en: For this is what the Lord says: “If those who do not deserve to drink the cup must drink it, can you possibly remain unpunished? You will not remain unpunished, for you must drink it too.

ngiemboon: Páʼ n gee Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la, n dɔgɔ lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn ńkʉa ngie sẅɛ̂láʼ gẅi Mbosela ge gÿo cʉ́ʼʉ jʉʼʉ mentʉ̀ menò, é cʉ́ʼʉ tsẅɛʼɛ́ mekʉ̀ŋe. Mé ge láʼ lɔgɔ yé, é pí fʉ̀ʼ na legɔɔn nò na ndòon; metÿǒsoŋ mé ge láʼ cʉ́ʼʉ gwɔ́ pɔ́ metsẅɛʼɛ́ metóon. Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ gɔɔn.»
en: For by myself I have sworn”    #— #this is the Lord’s declaration #— #“Bozrah  # 49:13 = Edom’s capital will become a desolation, a disgrace, a ruin, and an example for cursing, and all its surrounding cities will become ruins forever.”  # 49:12–13 Jr 25:28–29; Am 1:12

ngiemboon: N ka júʼ tsɔ́ nkʉ̀ gẅie é fóo mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a,
en: I have heard an envoy from the  Lord;

ngiemboon: N ge lɔgɔ gù Éndɔ̀m é gÿo nzsònzèm tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ ntsèm,
en: I will certainly make you insignificant among the nations,

ngiemboon: Mânyìŋ ntsèm kɔ̌ɔn ḿbɔ́gɔ gú,
en: As to the terror you cause,

ngiemboon: Éndɔ̀m ge láʼ cʉ́ʼʉ tsẅɛʼɛ́ kʉ̀ŋe, epʉ̀a metsèm pie é ge láʼa cʉa wó, é ge láʼa líe, à kʉʼʉ wɔ́b. Pɔ́ ge láʼ gyá ntí gie mé la lɔg ńtága Éndɔ̀m, é líte ngwòŋ.
en: “Edom will become a desolation. Everyone who passes by her will be appalled and scoff because of all her wounds.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie: ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ mé la pyág metÿǒsoŋ Sondɔm pɔ́ ye Ngomɔɔ, tà mbɔɔ metÿǒsoŋ mie ée menkwɔʼɔ́ la, á ge gÿo gíŋ gwɔ́ pɔ́ púʼu na Éndɔ̀m, mé té gÿo gíŋ tsẅé wó wɔ́.
en: As when Sodom and Gomorrah were overthrown along with their neighbors,”   says the Lord, “no one will live there; no human being will stay in it even temporarily.  # 49:18 Jr 49:33; 50:40; Zph 2:9

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie:
en: “Look, it will be like a lion coming from the thickets   of the Jordan to the watered grazing land.  # 49:19 Jr 50:44 I will chase Edom away from her land in a flash. I will appoint whoever is chosen for her. For who is like me?  # 49:19 Mc 7:18 Who will issue me a summons?  # 49:19 Jb 9:19; Jr 12:5; 50:44; Zch 11:3 Who is the shepherd who can stand against me? ”  # 49:19 2Ch 20:6; Jb 41:10

ngiemboon: Pí júʼu mmó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ka záb,
en: Therefore, hear the plans that the Lord has drawn up against Edom and the strategies he has devised against the people of Teman:   The flock’s little lambs will certainly be dragged away,  # 49:20 Jr 15:3; 22:19 and their grazing land will be made desolate because of them.  # 49:20 Jr 9:10; 23:10; 25:30–38

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ge gÿo gwete ssé tà tsetsáʼ nʉʼʉ,
en: At the sound of their fall the earth will quake;   the sound of her cry will be heard at the Red Sea.  # 49:18–21 Jr 50:40,44–46

ngiemboon: Ngàŋmbù aa páʼ gúmndóŋ gẅie à zie tà ńkúu tÿǒ, ńtaa mbabá mé na Mbosela. Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́, memǎa palÿɔ́ʼncù pʉ̀a Éndɔ̀m cʉ́ʼʉ ńcÿɔʼɔ pɔ́ páʼ manzwě gẅie à ne ńdúmo ńgee ńzyé la.
en: Look! It will be like an eagle soaring upward, then swooping down and spreading its wings over Bozrah. In that day the hearts of Edom’s warriors will be like the heart of a woman with contractions.

ngiemboon: Nkʉ̀ gẅie é líe pʉ̀a Ndamásè.
en: About Damascus:

ngiemboon: Mbwó pʉ̀a Ndamásè pǔ ḿbÿɛ́,
en: Damascus has become weak;

ngiemboon: Mé kéen ńgwáʼa tÿǒsoŋo gie mé pú ńzsé,
en: How can the city of praise not be abandoned,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ne ńgɔɔn ngie: Áa yɛ̌ tá á ge láʼ gwɔ́ lyɛʼó ŋwɛ́, ngwàshùm ntsèm gie ee Ndamásè pú ńgwete mángyɛ̌, palÿɔ́ʼncù ntsèm pie ée wó, e pú ńkwéte.
en: Therefore, her young men will fall in her public squares;

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo shÿɔ́g mmɔ̌g na metʉ̂ankáʼ Ndamásè, é pú tuɔ nɔʼɔ Mbɛ́d-Andad.
en: I will set fire to the wall of Damascus;

ngiemboon: Nkʉ̀ gẅie é líe pʉ̀a Kendaa, pâ pʉ̀a Atsɔ̂ɔ pie Nambukondonozɔɔ fùɔ Mbambilonia la jÿó wɔ́b na ncù, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: About Kedar   and the kingdoms of Hazor, which King Nebuchadnezzar  # 49:28 2Kg 24:11; 25:22; 2Ch 36:6–13 of Babylon defeated, this is what the Lord says:

ngiemboon: Pi gwoon mentàb mɔ́b lâ menùɔ menɔ̀ɔn mɔ́b ńkẅé,
en: They will take their tents and their flocks

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Run! Escape quickly! Lie low,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: Rise up, attack a nation at ease,

ngiemboon: Megàŋmbù ge gÿo jʉ mekamɛɛ pɔ́b
en: Their camels will become plunder,

ngiemboon: Atÿǒsoŋo Atsɔ̂ɔ ge gÿo cʉ́ʼ
en: Hazor will become a jackals’ den,

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la cʉ́me nkʉ̀ wé mbwó Yelemî ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Ssé, nkʉ̀ ŋwɛ́ gwɔ́ gẅie é líe pʉ̀a Elam. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gwaa cʉ́me wɔɔn nkʉ̀ ŋwɛ́, Sendesíasè fùɔ pà Yúndà nyé tá ńjÿó lefùɔ.
en: This is the word of the Lord that came to the prophet Jeremiah about Elam   at the beginning of the reign of King Zedekiah of Judah.  # 49:34 Jr 27:12; 28:1; 29:3

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ ne ńgɔɔn ngie:
en: This is what the Lord of Armies says:

ngiemboon: N ge fó shÿó twó,
en: I will bring the four winds against Elam

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo epʉ̀a Elam pú ḿvɛɛ
en: I will devastate Elam before their enemies,

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo zẅé fùɔ Elam,
en: I will set my throne in Elam,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋ ńne ńgɔɔn ngie: «N ge láʼa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ,
en: Yet, in the last days,
